ai-dt2.4:0.3_0: The four ways of being inclusive in the meaning and the reckonings
ai-dt2.4:1.2_0: by way of these things, being included in the form aggregates, the sense fields, and thoughts connected with the joints of the sense fields, by comprehension of the elements, by comprehension of the sense-spheres, by diverse elements, and by inclusion, of the sense fields.
ai-dt2.4:1.3_0: the one aggregates, by one sense-sphere, are included in the elements.
ai-dt2.4:2.2_0: the qualities of a male spirit ...
ai-dt2.4:2.13_0: ‘I will not think what is unfinished,’ and with conscientious thoughts,
ai-dt2.4:3.2_0: ignorance is a condition for choices. ...
ai-dt2.4:3.3_0: the six sense fields are conditions for contact ...
ai-dt2.4:3.5_0: Craving is a condition for grasping. ...
ai-dt2.4:3.9_0: There are things that are painful ...
ai-dt2.4:3.10_0: Thoughts that are sadness connected with sadness ...
ai-dt2.4:5.2_0: roots and all things are connected with the teaching ...
ai-dt2.4:5.3_0: roots and all things associated with it,
ai-dt2.4:5.8_0: The Realized One has given up any desire, ill will,
ai-dt2.4:5.13_0: thoughts that are defiled and defilements ...
ai-dt2.4:5.14_0: thoughts that are defiled and perished,
ai-dt2.4:5.15_0: Thoughts connected with the defilements are included by the defilements and the sense fields beginning with the defilements. According to the ending of the defilements. They include them in the analysis of the elements. Their sense fields are included in phenomena.
ai-dt2.4:5.16_0: the one aggregates, by one sense-sphere, are included in the elements.
ai-dt2.4:7.1_0: The fourth ways of being inclusive in the Saṅgha
